text.0: come to this sacrifice of ours o agni threefold with seven threads and five divisions.
text.1: be our oblationbearer and preceder thou hast lain long enough in during darkness.
text.2: i come a god foreseeing from the godless to immortality by secret pathways.
text.3: while i ungracious one desert the gracious leave mine own friends and seek the kin of strangers.
text.4: looking to the guest of other lineage have founded many a rule of law and order.
text.5: i bid farewell to the great god the father and for neglect obtain my share of worship.
text.6: i tarried many a year within this altar i leave the father for my choice is indra.
text.7: away pass agni varuṇa and soma rule ever changes this i come to favour.
text.8: these asuras have lost their powers of magic but thou o varuṇa if thou dost love me.
text.9: o king discerning truth and right from falsehood come and be lord and ruler of my kingdom.
text.10: here is the light of heaven here allis lovely here there is radiance here is airs wide region.
text.11: let us two slaughter vṛtra forth o soma thou art oblation we therewith will serve thee.
text.12: the sage hath fixed his form by wisdom in the heavens varuṇa with no violence let the waters flow.
text.13: like womenfolk the floods that bring prosperity have eau lit his hue and colour as they gleamed and shone.
text.14: these wait upon his loftiest power and vigour he dwells in these who triumph in their godhead.
text.15: and they like people who elect their ruler have in abhorrence turned away from vṛtra.
text.16: they call him swan the abhorrent floods companion moving in friendship with celestial waters.
text.17: the poets in their thought have looked on indra swiftly approaching when anustup calls him.
